verses.roman:
evaṁ-vidhāny anekāni
trāsanāny amanasvinām
sasṛjus tigma-gataya
āsuryā māyayāsurāḥ

synonyms: evam-vidhāni—(phenomena) like this; anekāni—many varieties of; trāsanāni—fearful; amanasvinām—to the less intelligent men; sasṛjuḥ—they created; tigma-gatayaḥ—of heinous nature; āsuryā—demoniac; māyayā—by illusion; asurāḥ—the demons.
translation: The demon Yakṣas are by nature very heinous, and by their demoniac power of illusion they can create many strange phenomena to frighten one who is less intelligent.
